moves.1. d4: Hi everyone!  This was an interesting game with a material imbalance which Bob kicks off with 1. d4.  Bob had a R + Piece + Pawn for Glenda.  My opponent's material balance so nearly worked in his favour.  At the end Bob's rook, two minor pieces and a pawn were swarming around Henry.  It looked as though I was going to cop Old Matey, but wait, what about Glenda?  Well ....... read on .....
moves.6. O-O c5 7. c3 Qb6 8. Nbd2 d6 9. d5: 9. d5 - white has a spatial advantage with this move.  He also has a lead in development.  I try to catch up.
moves.9... Nd7 10. Rb1 Ne5 11. Nxe5 Bxe5: 11. ...... Bxe5 - the knight exchange does not bring much relief, in fact passivitis sets in like gangrene.
moves.14. e5 dxe5 15. Rxe5: 15. Rxe5 - now Bob's rook dominates the e file and it will look as though I am about to lose a pawn.
moves.15... h6 16. Qe2 O-O: 16. ....... 0-0 - at last - but I think I may be about to lose a pawn, or am I?
moves.17. Bh4 Rfe8 18. Rxe7 Rxe7 19. Qxe7 Re8: 19......... Re8 - It does seem as though I will lose that pawn but the Wicked Witch of the West is trapped!  However, Bob gets enough material for her worse luck!
moves.20. Bxf6 Rxe7 21. Bxe7: 21. Bxe7 - an interesting material imbalance and I think that the scales are in white's favour.
moves.21... Bc8 22. b3 f5 23. Re1 Bc3 24. Re2: 24. ....... Bd7 - I decide to block Bob's passer.
moves.25. Nf3 Bf6 26. h3 Bxe7 27. Rxe7: 27. Rxe7 - one pair of bishops is exchanged but Fou Leblanc is under castle fire.
moves.27... Qd6 28. Re1 Kg7 29. Ne5 Be8 30. Re: 31. ....... a5 - I try to consolidate my queenside.
moves.32. Nd3 Bf7 33. f4 h5: 33...... h5 - not much else to do.
moves.34. Rg3 Kh7 35. Ne5 Be8 36. Rg5 Kh6: 36. ....... Kh6 - making moves which I hope do not worsen my position.  Bob now opens me up.
moves.37. g4 hxg4 38. hxg4 fxg4 39. Rxg4 Kg7: 39. ...... Kg7 - sidesteps a possible rook check on h4 but the g pawn is lost and Henry now comes under a fearsome attack - right now I feel as though I am playing Freddy!
moves.41. Ne5 Ke7 42. Rg7+ Kf8: 42. ...... Kf8 - I feel as though I am stepping through a minefield.
moves.43. Ra7 Qh6 44. Ra8 Qh3: 44. ....... Qh3 - suddenly Bob finds himself a close encounter with Glenda!
moves.45. Bg6: 45. Bg6 - nasty attack on the pinned Fou Leblanc but not to worry, Glenda indirectly protects Fou Leblanc and Henry by keeping Bob's king in check!
moves.45... Qg3+ 46. Kh1 Qh3+: 46. ........Qh3+ - the white king is checked again.
moves.47. Kg1 Qg3+: 47. ....... Qg3+ and draw offer - I did not think that I had anything better than a perpetual here as Fou Leblanc is doubly attacked and only once defended by Henry.  I already have a 1 point material deficit.  Bob kindly accepts my offer.  GAME DRAWN.
